fields.value: State Economic and Government Finance Data

dsDescriptionValue.value: State economic and state government finance data, including data on the professionalization of state legislatures.  This is an update to Klarner, Carl, 2013, "State Economic Data", http://hdl.handle.net/1902.1/20404, Harvard Dataverse, V1, published February 25, 2013, which contained the file State_Econ_Quarterly2012_09_06.xlsx.  The title of this edition has been altered to better reflect the contents of the dataset.  State economic variables include 1) personal income (annual 1929-2014, quarterly; 1948q1-2015q1), 2) disposable income (annual 1948-2014), 3) gross state product (annual 1963-2014), 4) unemployment (annual 1960-2014, quarterly 1975q1-2015q3).  Quarterly data for all the above variables was also imputed from annual data when not available.  State government finance variables include total revenue, total revenue minus federal intergovernmental transfers, general revenue, multiple tax categories, total expenditure, general expenditure, budget surplus / deficit, debt at end of fiscal year, and spending on the state legislature.  The following calculations were made for state government finance data: 1) deflated by consumer price index (both national and regional), and computed as per capita, 2) deflated by state income, 3) deflated by gross state product, 4) differenced from last fiscal year, and 5) computed as percent changes from last fiscal year.

fields.value: The file 081StateEconAndGovFinancesForUse20151112.dta is the file with the final economic and state government finance data in it.  The file 081StateEconAndGovFinancesForUse20151112Codebook.docx is the codebook for 081StateEconAndGovFinancesForUse20151112.dta.  It has variable definitions and data sources.  The document 000_HowDataConstructed20151112.docx explains how the data were constructed, including step by step instructions for obtaining every data source used in the construction of file 081.  Most of this file is STATA code.  The file 000_STATA_Code20151112.do has all the STATA code used for construction of 081StateEconAndGovFinancesForUse.dta.  All of this code is also in the document 000_HowDataConstructed20151112.docx.  The zip folder 083SourceFiles includes all files used to construct this dataset, as well as some files that were created as intermediate steps along the way.  Dataverse isn't allowing me to upload this as a zip file, but feel free to contact me for it before this issue is resolved.  The files that may be of most interest in the zip folder 083SourceFiles have state government finance categories that do not appear in the file 081StateEconAndGovFinancesForUse.dta.  These files are 039_Revenues20150805.csv, 040_ExpendituresA20150805.csv, 041_ExpendituresB20150805.csv, 042_DebtandCashSecurities20150805.csvm 074StateGovFinances1992to2013.dta and 076StateGovFinanceItemCodes1996to2013.  State government finances for fiscal year 2014, as well as revised fiscal year 2013 data, are scheduled to be released by the U.S. Census sometime in January 2016.  Let me know if you have any questions or comments at Carl.Klarner@gmail.com.

value: This is an update to Klarner, Carl, 2013, "State Economic Data", http://hdl.handle.net/1902.1/20404, Harvard Dataverse, V1, published February 25, 2013, which contained the file State_Econ_Quarterly2012_09_06.xlsx.
